page.title: 02FARMING (1)
page.content: Farming is,without doubt,the main activity in the area. The biggest farmer is the owner of Woodman's Farms. This concern includes West Hill Farm and Avington Manor Dairy. Upto 1952 these two farms were the property of Avington Estate and in the hands of the Shelley family. When the estate was sold the present owner's step-father, bought the above two farms. The farm is typical of the area and will serve as a general example.He told us that in the 19th century much of the area was downland and used for sheep grazing.Little downland now remains and the owner says that most of it disappeared during the Second World War (1939-45) when the Government instructed it to be ploughed up so that food could be
